Can you see the buoy? Yes, it's there and it is still sort of in the littoral zone - only in 400 meters of water and about 3 km off shore.

<br>
<img align="center" img src="images/day_6-5.jpg" 
height="500px" width="500px" border="1" style="PADDING-TOP: 5px" style="PADDING-BOTTOM: 5px"/>

height="500px" width="500px" border="1" style="PADDING-TOP: 5px" style="PADDING-BOTTOM: 5px"/>

He doesn't care - just waiting for Peter to swim so he can raid the backpack.

<br>
<img align="center" img src="images/day_6-7.jpg"

Boats using LED lights a bit too near shore.

<br>
<img align="center" img src="images/day_6-9.jpg"

Runway, lights of houses, stars - nope - all the fishermen are out for the night attracting fish to net. They won't come in till after sunrise.
